column8: text

eHFA_wEK_00The people of Penang have been urged to save the state in the  general election by picking a party which is truly qualified to rule.Penang Opposition chief Datuk Jahara Hamid said this was because the DAP Penang state government which ruled Penang since 2008 had lost its integrity and transparency.“The Barisan Nasional  (BN) has successfully proven that the principle of  Efficiency, Accountability and Transparency in the Penang state government administration is dead.“BN has also succeeded in proving that many promises of the DAP state government have not been fulfilled and the sweet promises in the Pakatan Rakyat manifesto are not implemented,” she told a press conference at the State Assembly Building here yesterday.Penang opposition chief Datuk Jahara Hamid said this was because the DAP Penang state government which ruled Penang since 2008 had lost its integrity and transparencyShe said BN too had proven that the government headed by DAP had sold many parcels of land during their administration, namely, land which should have been developed by the Penang Development Corporation (PDC) for the well-being of the people.“This shows that the DAP state government gives priority to the interest of the private sector with mega projects and do not place importance on the interest of the people of Penang especially the needy,” she said.Overall, she said, BN was satisfied with the performance of all the 10 BN state assemblymen during the sitting which could be the last before the 14th general election.Meanwhile, Pulau Betong State Assemblyman Datuk Muhamad Farid Saad said the people must act appropriately to save the state from the wickedness of DAP.“All the land in the state will be sold off, if they are allowed to go on,” he said. — Bernamahttp://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia...h.O1D3Ioi5.dpuf

column7: From: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
column8: Who the hell is dependent on the govt?I'm not asking for the government to do everything. For example, I accept that keeping our country clean is very much our own responsibility, plus it would be great if our drivers and motorcyclists weren't mostly assholes all the time.But nevertheless, the govt has to be clean on its own without us needing to have to fix it by trying to vote them out of power.
"DAP state government have not been fulfilled and the sweet promises in the Pakatan Rakyat manifesto are not implemented,” What about BN manifesto? Ada full fill ka

column7: From: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
column8: Here's the thing - I can accept if its just another regular citizen making the point.But if its the govt or one of the cybertroopers, than its stupidly hypocritical.End of day, the govt is on the public payroll and has to be held to a higher standard. They don't get a free pass to songlap just because Malaysians themselves are not exactly squeaky clean themselves.

column7: From: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
column8: That really depends...Truth is if his country ends up like Turkey, its not like we won't do anything about it.I can promise if that if this country ever holds a referendum like Turkey and it actually looks like the ruling party is going to win in such a vote, I won't be sitting at home doing nothing.Although there's a good chance I might just get out of the country instead. Its one thing of the majority of the population opposes it, than its a people's movement to bring down a tyranny.But if half the people voted to have such a govt, probably the best thing to do is GTFO.
If you stay long enough in Penang (BN era vs opposition era), you will know who doing better for Penang. No needs to say much.
